website_summaries.verdict: This is an impressive “green” detergent powder that not only meets the needs of being more natural, but also performs well.
pros: Non-toxic and fragrance-free, which means that this detergent is stellar for those with sensitive skin and noses
Gets even the dirtiest clothes extremely clean
Only about a tablespoon is needed of this powder to wash a full load
cons: If too much powder is used, it may leave residue on darker clothes

website_summaries.verdict: Recommended by leading cloth diaper manufacturers and loved by parents for its powerful yet gentle cleaning action.
pros: Non-toxic, hypoallergenic, and gentle on delicate skin
Cleans deeply, lifts stains, and eliminates odors
Removes residual buildup from other detergents
Made of eco-friendly biodegradable ingredients and natural minerals, with zero dyes, brighteners or fragrances
Rinses well, leaving no residue behind
Only requires one tablespoon per wash
cons: It’s best to disinfect diapers to prevent rashes
May not work as well with hard water

customer_reviews.title: It will clog your pipes.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the soap for a few years, but we started to develop plumbing problems and the wash machine was backing up into the kitchen. Our contractor found that the entire run of plumbing from the wash machine to the main stack was completely clogged with powdered detergent. Charlie’s soap is the only powder I have ever used. The entire run of plumbing is being replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT use on black clothing!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing all the positive reviews, I purchased Charlie's Soap. The first time I used it, I found bleach-like splotches on my black shirt. So disappointing. I emailed the company along with a photo; no response. I called the company a week later and left a voicemail. It's been three weeks and they have yet to contact me. During this time I looked more closely at the reviews on Amazon and saw that this has happened to many others. Wish I had looked beyond good ratings before purchasing. : (
customer_reviews.author: mcctc

customer_reviews.title: Ruined Brand New Polo Shirt Among Others
customer_reviews.text: Dark cotton clothes get ruined by this stuff. I hate Charlie’s soap but my wife uses it. Whenever she washes my clothes she ruins them, just like the brand new polo shirt in my pic. Other clothes ruined by Charlie’s are my Eddie Bauer jeans and Joseph Abboud navy pants. I can’t warn people enough about this detergent. It will cost you way more money than the price of the soap.
customer_reviews.author: ASmith

customer_reviews.title: May cause skin burns if used with cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this product for washing cloth diapers so I can not speak to how well it cleans anything else. After the first use I noticed skin burns on my baby around the area of the gusset amd lower belly. I switched back to Tide and he was fine. A few weeks later, I tried this soap again and he ended up burned after just three diapers. If you are looking into this product for use with cloth diapers, do a bit more research before you buy. This detergent can react with different water types to cause burns. Apparently, some swear by it but it must depend on your water type.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Spahr White

customer_reviews.title: No smell=clean
customer_reviews.text: The smell of nothing never smelled so good! I have tried natural detergents, fragrance heavy detergents, and even made my own detergent. Despite good reviews, I was skeptical of this detergent. When I received it, I was even more so because of the tiny scoop enclosed to portion out for one load. One little scoop of this powder is no match for my laundry, I scoffed! Yet the first load came out of the dryer and every piece of clothing smelled just clean and fresh but had no particular fragrance. Even the old towels I use for puppy accidents come out smelling wonderful. So, I proclaim this my detergent for life
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish it's in the stronger container
customer_reviews.text: Product itself is lovely! I've been using it for 4 years, and I like how it washes well, without unnecessary chemical fragrance on my clothes. I don't notice any white residue on my color clothes. Probably using citric acid for rinse aid would help to prevent pipe clogging and sofer finish for your clothes. It used to be in a sturdy plastic container, but they changed to plastic bag now. Then it gets thinner bag, and it's easy to get puncture to make a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Berry

customer_reviews.title: This WORKS! Clean and leaves no residue
customer_reviews.text: This thing WORKS! 1 teaspoon per load and my clothes are cleaner than ever before. I am grateful to have heard about Charlie's Soap from a friend. At first it sounded unbelievable and I was unsure about the powder because I was wondering how it would wash out of the clothes. (The liquid wasn't a good option for me because of its rating on ewg.) I have not found any residue of the powder in any clothes and my clothes smell pure and clean - nothing artificial. Great option for babies who are sensitive to chemicals, especially my own preemie. Great buy! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doesn't get out any minor stains
customer_reviews.text: Sorry guys I love the story about the soap and everything but it just does not clean clothes. We've tried it over and over but today we gave up and bought something from the supermarket. Our old mass market detergent got out 99 percent of minor kid related dirt and food stains but Charlie soap gets out 0 percent of them.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Gunk gone
customer_reviews.text: I have only done one load since receiving this, but it was gratifying to look thru the glass door of my washer and see residue and gunk coming out of even the last rinse. My clothes were lightly worn, so they weren't that 'dirty', but the previous chemical detergent and softeners were getting washed out. Clothes were definitely softer . my fleece robe feels fleecy again. My flannel shirt felt like flannel. My nighties feel better than new. I am reserving the last star because some reviewers said they noticed a 'stale' odor after maybe a year of washing, and I want to see if that happens or doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Shorsue

customer_reviews.title: Even works on excrement-soiled sheets/clothes. GREAT FOR CAREGIVERS
customer_reviews.text: This soap is recommended by detox guru Wendy Meyers, so I tried it. We LOVE this. My clothes are an easy wash, so no problem. The man of the home is out and sweating all day and Charlie's soap works great. We also have an incontinent, bed-ridden, loved one in the home (so we do at least one down-and-dirty load per day), and this soap leaves all the sheets fresh and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Flora

customer_reviews.title: My. new. soap.  YAY.
customer_reviews.text: Omigosh I love this. It works great, even on my husband's sweaty construction clothes and my son's greasy chef's clothes. No huge heavy plastic jug. No sticky, goopy liquid dripping all over. A dainty little scoop sprinkled around the tub in 2 seconds, and Done. The bag even securely zips shut easily. I use this in a traditional full-water top loading machine. If you use a low-water machine... sorry, you may have been conned by beverage companies who put that "saved" water into plastic bottles and sell it to you on supermarket shelves at premium prices. End of Rant ;)
customer_reviews.author: Chena

customer_reviews.title: Smells like nothing, keeps laundry fresh
customer_reviews.text: If you are assaulting everyone else with your fragrance, please stop and switch to something clean and unscented. This keeps our laundry very clean, and our front liad washer stays squeaky clean. I gave a bag to my parents who use it in their top loader, and they say their clothes seem cleaner, they like the fresh smell, and it work great, and has lasted them a ling time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan & Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in place of Molly’s Suds, as it was less expensive at the time. I would say this is an equivalent product to Molly’s Suds and other natural laundry detergents, like Norwex. [Living in a small apartment I do not have the space to make my own.] Charlie’s washed my clothes as expected and the detergent dissolved in the wash. My clothes were clean and had no fragrance. I washed my clothes on either the normal or delicate setting and always in cold water— no issues either time. I have used the detergent in both a top load standard washer and a front load high energy washer. Always the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bee

customer_reviews.title: It works when nothing else will!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried everything to get the smell out of my T shirts (I believe it came from using low quality Solimo detergent) and nothing worked until this. I tried rockin green, vinegar, oxyclean, etc and the smell persisted regardless of how many times I washed them. Everything that would go in my tshirt drawer would end up with the same smell! I followed the directions and washed my shirts with hot water 3 times in a row, and sure enough, it did the trick! I was honestly ready to throw them all away. I am a Charlie’s laundry soap believer and learned my lesson about cheap detergent that leaves a residue.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaE223

customer_reviews.title: I don't smell like laundry detergent/dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: I have used Charlie's soap for about 10 years now. I'll never go back to commercial/store bought laundry detergent again. NO fragrance, no dryer sheets necessary. It saves so much money as you only need a tablespoon, no dryer sheets, softens naturally and most of all, I don't smell like laundry detergent/dryer sheets. I hate being around people that smell like that. And most of all, it actually cleans your clothes so very well.
customer_reviews.author: cooking girl

customer_reviews.title: So fresh and so clean
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? You are saving the environment, it's lasts forever, perfect for those with sensitive skin. I don't get why every product has scent these days it's weird. I strongly encourage anyone with eczema to try this. It also cleans really well. I've always done liquid because when I was younger I hated getting some crystals in my clothing but it doesn't happen with this product. My mom uses it. Think I recommended it to all my friends. I think I may be getting old.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several green laundry detergent versions over the years, and always keep coming back to this one. It is, by far, the best working one on stains, sweat, etc. In addition, it is great for sensitive skin - no irritation, reactions, or rashes. Even better, a little goes a long way - and when combined with the water softener/stain booster or borax, no stain stands a chance (even kids-created mystery stains). Interestingly, it has no scent - which is something I had to get used to, but find most pleasant now. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Best laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different laundry detergents over the years, and this is by far my favorite. It has a mild, clean scent that does not aggravate allergies or make you think of chemicals, and it cleans beautifully. I use this detergent for washing everything that runs through my washing machine: clothes (dark, light, & delicates), towels, sheets, blankets, and quilts. I have never had a problem with this stuff. No damage to clothing or washing machines, no residue on anything, and no skin sensitivity for anyone in my household. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CaniacGirl

customer_reviews.title: Love it with the booster, works so well
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, seems like it works best in concert with the Charlie's booster (or at least if you have hard water). This is my favorite laundry detergent (aside from Tide Ultra Stain release, which I can only find at Target). Have poor water quality where I am most of the time (San Diego area), and yet my stuff gets noticeably cleaner with this. (I always use Woolite for darks on my dark stuff though!)
customer_reviews.author: BGrace

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Washes a LOT of Loads
customer_reviews.text: 9 months ago, I bought a bag of this. It works even better than expected... the clothes are clean and fresh every time no matter how soiled they started out. I just ordered another bag... not because I ran out (I still have about 2 months left) but because things are so different with Covid-19 I didn't want to run out and not be able to get more when I needed it. So basically, 1 bag lasted our 2-person family 1 year... and did a better job cleaning clothes than the commercial stuff I used to buy at the grocery store!
customer_reviews.author: cottercat

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I found Charlie’s Soap 10 years ago and haven’t had any problems. All The negative reviews seem to be about people using too much soap. 1/2 to 1 Tablespoon is plenty per load of clothes in my HE washer. No smell, doesn’t bother my skin, and cleans clothes perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and did not clean my cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: This was ineffective on all levels. I washed with a Tbs(as recommended for heavy loads) with a small batch of cloth diapers(on hot water) and it didn’t touch the smell. In fact it has some weird chemical smell even though it’s fragrance free. I did a load with 3 Tbs( with hot water) and my diapers still had poop smell on them plus the weird chemical smell. Not happy at all with this product despite raving recommendations on it for cloth diapers. It did not clean the poop out like it advertises. At least not for me.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Get you some
customer_reviews.text: I’m old. I’ve used a LOT of laundry soap. First got it at a health food store. I. Do NOT come close to understanding why this is healthy or good for the environment. That said: 1. It’s VERY effective. Clothes smell and look cleaner. 2. Easy to store. Only use a teeny bit and comes with a little spoon. Con: I put in in as glass container for easier access w/ screw on lid. Comes in a “resealable” bag but I’m not good at lining up those indentations to perfectly airtight close these type bags (except Ziplock). Best detergent out there so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy3339

customer_reviews.title: This is now my staple laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: I used to go between a few brands of laundry detergent depending what was on sale. But was never really happy with how they cleaned. A review written that sold me on Charlies was spot on. Wash your clothes 2 or 3 times in Charlies and you'll be amazed at the feel of the fabric. I do think the other soaps just don't rinse clean or have chemicals that leave residue. This is on my monthly subscribe and save list. I'm 55 so I've tried many detergents - can honestly say I don't think I'll be experimenting with any other brands
customer_reviews.author: SouthernBelleAtl

customer_reviews.title: Not for cloth diapers nor is it hypoalergenic.
customer_reviews.text: My All detergent wasn't doing so great, so i gave this a try. My cloth diapers got so nasty, they always smelled of urine and I had to strip them every other month. My little guy had eczema and it had him constantly breaking out. Switched again to Tide, and I've had no problems since. I would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined about $1000 worth of clothes
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has had sensitive skin for years, I tried Charlie's soap and I really wanted to like it. A lot of people complained about the scent, but I actually didn't have any issues with that as it smelled very fresh- the problem however, is that a lot of my clothes were left with a white film on them that I could not get out. This soap ruined about $1000 worth of my clothes and I will never use it again. If you have sensitive skin, try something like Molly's Suds (unscented) or Nellie's laundry soda which are vastly superior to this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: I won't use any other soap
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on products when I was pregnant. When it came to laundry I needed something that worked, and was safe for me and my baby. That meant scent and dye free. But I also wanted something that was safe for the environment. I have sensitive skin and turns out my baby does too. I tried a few different soaps but this was the only one that didn't trigger my eczema. My clothes are clean, works well on stains and no residue to irritate my skin. I'm happy and won't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Leaves white spots all over my darks. I also think it’s fading them.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner28

customer_reviews.title: Works, Smells Great, Last Forever
customer_reviews.text: I use this laundry detergent for my cloth diapers because it is so clean and won't cause buildup on the diapers. It works great and lasts FOREVER. I only have to buy a new bag every 4-5 months or so because one little scoop is enough for a whole load of dirty diapers. They smell super fresh after cleaning as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sam K.

customer_reviews.title: Ruins Darks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this soap for 6 months now. It seems to clean towels, diapers, and clothes well BUT this soap ruins my clothes. It leaves white stains on darks. Maybe it’s my washer or my water, but it still ruins clothes. At first it was seldom, but I have lost two nice shirts recently. I’m done washing shirts and pants for fear that another shirt will have a bleach-like stain on it.
customer_reviews.author: Carole B

customer_reviews.title: Soap Residue Build-Up in Dispenser!
customer_reviews.text: I'm afraid that I cannot give this soap a good review. I have noticed that there is a soap build-up residue in my washing machine's soap disenser. I just threw out a small stone's size of soap. I am hoping that there isn't any build-up in the piping that could cause a problem down the road. I will be going back to Nellie's laundry soda for my clothes and machine as I never had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Charlie's for Baby Clothes
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this two and a half years ago when I was expecting my daughter. I didn't want to use Dreft and I wanted something organic and good for infant clothing. I read a lot of reviews and landed on Charlie's and loved it. My daughter ended up being born with pretty bad eczema which she still deals with so we have to be really careful about what she comes in contact with. Charlie's has never made her break out. We are expecting our third child next week so I made sure to order another bag to wash all the new clothes. I definitely trust this brand and would recommend for anyone with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: They work just as well and your clothes don't stink like fake perfumes
customer_reviews.text: Charlie's Soap is all I've used for the past 5-7 years. My "crunchy green" daughter found it after she kept getting rashes from every single other laundry detergent she tried. Charles's soap gets your clothes clean, get rid of any residue buildup from other laundry detergents and softeners. Never use fabric softener, either. Buy the wool balls you put in the dryer. They work just as well and your clothes don't stink like fake perfumes. Charlie's is biodegradable, environmentally safe and hypoallergenic.
customer_reviews.author: MoMo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using Charlie's Soap for my family's laundry needs. I love that the product goes back to the basics of what makes good soap, that it is without scent, and that a little bit of product goes a long way. So far, with a family of two, one 2.64lb bag lasted us about 9 months of 1-2 loads per week. With a baby on the way, I anticipate that we will go through a bag more quickly, but I intend to continue using this for all our laundry needs, the baby's included. I trust this brand and would highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: prashant kumar

customer_reviews.title: Looks expensive but lasts a long time, so it's really economical
customer_reviews.text: This product gets the clothes clean without a lot of waste. The ~2-pound bag lasted 8+ months for our household of two. I've used Charlie's Soap all-purpose cleaner for years and only recently started using the laundry powder. I will keep on using it.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Gael

customer_reviews.title: Great for Front Loaders
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this product because it also comes in single-use packets that I wanted to take on a trip. A bonus was that I had read that Charlie's Soap leaves front-loading washing machines smell fresh (mustiness is the default!). It's true. I love that my clothes and my washer no longer smell. The expensive products I previously used didn't do as good a job. This time, when I bought my second batch, I didn't realize that I hadn't selected the single-use packets. I knew I'd need a tablespoon for measuring. To my pleasant surprise, one comes in the bag. This product is reasonably priced and works well. I'm sticking with it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend Charlie's Soap
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product that I have been using for about two years now. I have very sensitive skin and tend to develop an allergic reaction to many types of laundry detergents. I also like that you use just a small scoop - it doesn't have the fillers the big brands do. I have tried both the liquid and powder and will probably stick with the powder as it seems more environmentally friendly. In terms of cleaning, I'm not the one to speak on that as I'm 65 and not rolling around in grass and dirt! :-) In my case having a product that I can use that doesn't irritate my skin trumps having the whitest whites.
customer_reviews.author: Valenka

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this because it was one of the few laundry detergents that could be used on a cloth diapers. After trying it on my clothes I have not gone back to my old detergent! It is so gentle and helps colors hold up really well. I also have extreme allergies to laundry detergents and this is one of the few that I have been able to use without any issues. Highly recommended for cloth diapers, baby clothes, anyone with allergy issues, or anyone just looking for an eco-friendly detergent.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I switched to Charlie's Soap a couple of years ago when my skin started breaking out with the previous laundry soap. It works amazingly well. It takes care of gym odors extremely well. It also removes oil and makeup stains extremely well. I use a natural deodorant and it leaves residue and oil stains on the armpits, however, this is not a problem for me, because Charlie's Soap removes them completely!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy  Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Better than Seventh Generation powder
customer_reviews.text: Way better than Seventh Generation free and clear powder detergent. Much more gentle on our clothes - gets whites whiter and MUCH less fading of colors and darks. Methylisothiazolinone/Methylisothiazoline-free, which is a must in our household due to chemical allergy reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Leng Family

customer_reviews.title: Especially good for infant laundry and for hand washing laundry.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, especially for hand washing laundry! I've had some issues with getting my bed linens clean in the washing machine. Now, any time something comes out of the machine looking not quite clean, I quick add some Charlie's soap to a basin/sink of water and watch the water turn gray as the detergent penetrates the residual dirt and scum. I also use this detergent in my regular washing machine loads. I like that it is an effective detergent, leaves my laundry smelling neutral, and so far it seems to be fine for our newborn's clothing and linens.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love that I only have to use a small amount to get a full load clean. I recently put Charlie’s Soap to a true test. My child is in the marching band and the uniforms needed to be washed. As you can imagine after being worn for 4 hot football games they were pretty dirty and smelly! Charlie’s soap did a fantastic job of getting them brilliantly clean. Our kids look great for their first competition this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Erne Barras

customer_reviews.title: Love this soap! Takes out the stench!
customer_reviews.text: I love this soap and was amazed at how it got rid of the mildewy stench from our towels. We have a front loader washing machine so sometimes odor can build up on clothes and towels. But Charlie’s came to the rescue! In the past I’ve used this soap for cloth diapers too. Works great and you only need a little powder for each load.
customer_reviews.author: Kangaroo Court

customer_reviews.title: Charlie's is the best
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Charlie's soap for at least ten years, maybe 15? I've tried other natural detergents, but always come back to Charlie's because it does the job. I use it for everything - underwear, linens, "hand wash" items -- in water temperatures ranging from eco cold (that's a setting on my machine) to hot. No complaints, only clean clothes.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Dont think about it. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: So my cloth diapers smelled like a barn, which in turn made my clothes smell like a barn. I got desperate and tried this stuff. And I LOVE IT. Our clothes have never been fresher. Even before the baby. I'm obsessed and I could totally tell the difference in the cleanliness of my washing machine. I've read on some cloth diapering forums that they get burns. But that's honestly an issue with not following directions. With ALL cloth diapering systems. You pre rinse, wash, then rinse again. Or you will run into mineral build up, lack of absorbency, and rashes. Anyways I'm thankful for this magic detergent. It's been an absolute god send.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey bowman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted Charlie's soap to work. I'm giving it three stars because it does get the stench out pretty well, even from sweaty athletic clothes. More importantly, it gets rid of the mildew smell that is always in my clothes after washing, if I don't dry the clean clothes immediately. However, Charlie's soap leaves out clothes feeling stiff and rough, like they've been line dried. This doesn't bother me as much as I grew up with line dried clothes and associate the feeling with clean clothes, but it's a no go for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Safe for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I'm allergic to methylisothiazolinone, which is found in so many laundry products. Charles is safe enough for a baby and my sensitive skin. It is also very economical, cleans well and safe for the environment. NO scent ... just clean.
customer_reviews.author: bkd'a

customer_reviews.title: I’ll continue to use Charlie’s
customer_reviews.text: Charlie’s soap is what I always order. When I decided to go more earth friendly and body friendly, Charlie’s was my choice and I haven’t been disappointed. I do sometimes have to use an earth friendly spot remover but we have an active household that get spots and stains. I will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie Lasater

customer_reviews.title: Earthy wet dog smell.... gross
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wash my new babies clothes in. But I cannot do it. This detergent smells like wet dog to me. Its absolutely disgusting. My husband doesn't think it smells "that" bad so I gave it to him. I also gave it two stars because my husband doesnt mind it as much as I do. I would give it 1 myself. I won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Used it for years but no more🙁
customer_reviews.text: I used this for years now and I thought I liked it but not anymore.My clothes are not getting clean and smell awful, especially workout type clothes and non Cotten tanks and dresses.They smell so bad and I can’t stand to wear them without adding a scent booster to each load until I finish the bag I have left .I don’t know what happened but I’ll be switching for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: No more smelly wahing machine and clean clothes to boot!!
customer_reviews.text: I had used this soap in the past but switch when i received a notice stating it was no longer available with ship and save. Used some pods for a couple of months and noticed my washing machine started smelling like mildew. Noticed that this was still available and decided to switch back. Within 2 weeks my washer no longer smelled bad and everything is clean and clear. So glad I found this again!
customer_reviews.author: Dasdman

customer_reviews.title: Deep cleans, no toxins, fresh smell, great for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: My laundry smells fresh, love the deep clean. I like a little scent but have learned to live without it. I have tried other similar products, but none I like as well. I and my grandson have sensitive skin, head and shoulders above any of the “baby” detergents that are out there. One of the most popular baby detergent’s that are touted as “pediatrician recommended “ is over 50% chemically derived and can be toxic to babies and young children. Sometimes it is a stretch to buy on my budget, but it is worth it. I’ve been using it for years and never use anything else. My home is 100% chemically free, and that is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bgcookie

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: My workout clothes still smell after washing with this soap. I tried varying the amount of soap like some people suggested, but all I got were either very unwashed clothes or clothes with soap residue. I recommend HEX performance unscented, which actually makes clothes clean. I just wanted to switch to a powder because it's less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Clothes come out with bleach-like splotches.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product a few times, and several pieces of clothing came out with bleach-like splotches on them. One item was a brand new navy blue top that now has splotches all over it. I stopped using this product, went back to using Seventh Generation laundry detergent, and I have not had this problem again. I can only determine that the problem was caused by using Charlie’s Soap.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cazenavette

customer_reviews.title: Great laundry soap
customer_reviews.text: I love this soap so much. I used to only use it on our cloth diapers. It was great at getting the diapers clean without irritating our babies skin. Now that the kids are bigger I’m using Charlie’s soap on all of our laundry. It was the only detergent that could get the mildew smell out of our towels or the sweat smell out of my husband’s work out clothes. Now it’s e only laundry soap I use. I also love that it doesn’t have any smell.
customer_reviews.author: Coley

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Rash
customer_reviews.text: This soap gave me a horrible rash all over my chest and back. I think it’s due to the Sodium metasilicate.
customer_reviews.author: Mart

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy with this Laundry Powder
customer_reviews.text: I have used this laundry powder for over two years now and I am really pleased with how well it cleans our clothes. I originally purchased it because I am super sensitive to fragrances and my kids and I have sensitive skin. Definitely a win-win with no fragrances and great cleaning power. I also use the Charlie's Soap Booster powder and of course still pretreat potential stains with Puracy Natural Stain Remover.
customer_reviews.author: proamazonmom

customer_reviews.title: Great detergent, recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this detergent for my newborn because I've read so many great reviews on it and the natural ingredients and such. However after 3 months of using it I'm hooked. I've already put in a subscription order to deliver every few months and recommended it to my family members who love it as well! This really gets all the stains out -- and I've definitely had a few poo blow outs that I've had to clean. It's well priced.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Non-toxic and does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Charlie's soap for over 8 years. I tried different non-toxic brands but I have always found something that I didn't like-price, cleaning, too powdery-going right in my eyes and nose. I usually soak my laundry for 3-4 hours, this is how my mom did it years ago, they come out perfectly clean. If there are stains, I treat them with the appropriate product and then I wash them. So happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly did not think that I would love a laundry soap as much as I do. I can't believe how clean my laundry gets. It's honestly shocking for me. Not only that but I love scented things and knowing this doesn't have a scent bummed me out....BUT using the product now I don't care. Everything smells fresh and clean. It doesn't even need a scent! I won't be buying anything else. This stuff is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Watts

customer_reviews.title: No the best.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used other natural laundry detergents and my laundry was always fresh and smelled cleaned. This stuff left me wondering how clean my clothes were. It left my clothes smelling dull and slightly gross.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: My favorite laundry detergent
customer_reviews.text: We use this detergent for our daughter’s cloth diapers. It takes no more than a tablespoon, so it’ll last a long time! Because it’s a detergent rather than a soap, it leaves no residue, and does not lead to buildup on her diapers, keeping them nice and absorbant, and smelling fresh! It’s also better for your wash machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashtyn Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great! natural and simple but also cleans
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really cleans our clothes, especially it seems from the stuff the other standard soap like Tide or even Arm and Hammer weres leaving in our clothes. And keeps the washer clean. If you're after scents, this doesn't really have any, but that's what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb (Achy Dad) Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great soap, mediocre instructions
customer_reviews.text: This soap has been great for us for cleaning cloth diapers. It washes well and rinses clean. My only complaint is that the instructions are not great. They tell you to use 2/3 tbsp for regular loads or 1 tbsp for large/heavy soiled loads. However, the scoop only gives a measurement if 14.7 cc ( which is about 1 tbsp). It would be clearer to say to use 2/3 of a scoop for regular load and one scoop for a heavy soil / largel load. Otherwise, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: A. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Simply Works!
customer_reviews.text: We purchase Charlie’s Soap as a replacement to the harsher Tide Pods in preparation for our newborn son. After one-month of dirty diapers and sweaty tennis clothes the product has surprisingly worked as advertised. Odor and stain removal claims are valid with the added bonus of zero irritation to our newborn’s skin. Note: 1) It is advised to pre-soak your dingiest items to ensure stain removal. 2) This is the only detergent used to prevent cross contamination.
customer_reviews.author: Warrick Moran

customer_reviews.title: Got blueberry stain out of white sheets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for washing baby stuff and it has not disappointed! My son spit up in his crib after eating blueberries, and I wasn’t able to wash it right away so there was a huge purple set-in stain on his white crib sheet. This detergent got it out without any pretreating!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: I love Charlie's products.
customer_reviews.text: I love Charlie's products. I normally use the liquid (which is great) but for traveling in the RV I take the powder. Does a great job cleaning clothes and, if you're a person who is sensitive to laundry soaps, you will be glad to know that this will not irritate your skin. Also, leaves your washing machine cleaner than other commercial products.
customer_reviews.author: vickib

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly effective
customer_reviews.text: My clothes have never been this clean! Switched from years of using Persil because our towels continued to smell despite trying vinegar washes regularly and I noticed my yoga bras and and shirts retained the sweat smell. After a few washes with Charlie Soap (it wasn’t immediate, I feel like it needed to cut through the layers of crap?!) but then everything seemed to be extremely fresh! Very happy
customer_reviews.author: L. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this recently to wash cloth diapers and so far so good! Our little one has very sensitive skin and this seems to wash clear and no irritation on his skin at all. And great at getting stains out of cloth so that’s saying something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best eco detergent
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many brands. This one is the best and it's so cheep! With only 1/2 scoop, clothes come out very clean and fresh. However, there is almost no scent. I add a little Method scent beads to the laundry because I like the light scent. I find I do not need dryer sheets with this product, which is even more eco-friendly. as most dryer sheets contain petrochemicals which emit VOCs from the clothes.
customer_reviews.author: nycguy

customer_reviews.title: such a new fan!!
customer_reviews.text: i am so happy .. i had read the reviews and was so curious ... this works ... my hubby sweat a bunch .. in his work clothing and he has to look nice and this works so well ... men don't wanna smell like flowers ... glad this is scentless ... so great .. hope it will continue to work well ... i have done 7 or so washes ... will continue to do so ... score!
customer_reviews.author: ElizrdbthSpeaks

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! great for my son when he was a newborn, he had eczema from multiple food allergies, so it was important that we had a laundry detergent free of further irritants. Does a great job even on my husbands clothes (he is a plumber) but it doesn't dissolve great in cold water, I dissolve it in a little cup of warm water before dumping in the wash so that clothes don't come out with powder still on them. Great for cloth diapers as well, don't forget vinegar for the rinse cycle and you're golden!
customer_reviews.author: smcomeau

customer_reviews.title: I'm not allergic, and it feels so good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm allergic to practically every soap, scent, and cleaning thing under the sun, but astoundingly, this doesn't make me break out. Seriously, even the most free and clear stuff gives me trouble. There's no scent to speak of, but everything comes out fresh, which is all I could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use this for cloth diapers and it seems to work well. No stinky leftover smell, but no perfume either. My only complaint would be that it doesn’t seem to work as well on my loads that I use cold water (I wash diapers in hot).
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: best detergent I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: So this guy comes up to me at the an event in Portsmouth, Ohio and gave me a free sample of this detergent. Said it's his father's company. As to not offend him I accepted it. Once I got home I tossed in a load and was shocked by how dirty my wash machine was. Water was almost black! After a few cycles I noticed that my work shirts actually lost what I thought was permanent bo smell. This product is awesome! No joke! I will be a loyal customer moving forward!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, clothes are clean
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised, it’s a smaller bag than expected because it Only requires a tablespoon per load, and my clothes feel cleaner than ever. I had gotten a name brand recently that gave me a terrible rash, so I went with something natural. Very glad that I did.
customer_reviews.author: parksshopping

customer_reviews.title: Clean and soft and simple
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is such a small amount per load. The cons would be that if you put too much in the clothes can get build up. The less you use the better. I find it cleans very well and love that there is no fragrance. My husband prefers scents so this is hard for him to get used to. His smelly clothes have been cleaning well and everything is very soft as long as I use full loads of water and not a full scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have sensitive skin,  Charlies soap is for you!
customer_reviews.text: I loooove this soap! My fiancé and I have sensitive skin and allergies and we have had no issues using the soap for our clothes, bath towels etc This bag lasts us sooo long since you only need a small scoop full (scoop included) for an entire load. With any powdered laundry detergent make sure you let it mix in the water before adding clothes in the wash. I will continue to buy this product in the future!
customer_reviews.author: G. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Another convert
customer_reviews.text: Recently made the switch while trying to figure out how to address the smell in the front-loading washer after all of the tricks to clean it out weren’t making a difference, and how to get the clothes from workouts and rebuilding engines to come out actually smelling clean. We’ve been using this for a couple of weeks now and it’s a huge change. It solved our problem and isn’t full of chemicals, which is important to me. I’m a convert. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin L. Kozelsky

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Great and Wonderful for Sensitive Skin!
customer_reviews.text: Great soap for cleaning clothes. Takes out most stains and is great for people that are sensitive to laundry detergents. Super concentrated so a little goes a long way. Comes with a small measuring scoop that makes it quick and easy to put in washer. Only needs one scoop per load unless you have clothes that are really soiled then two scoops works great!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Annunzio

customer_reviews.title: We like it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My baby had eczema and it got worse while we were using other brands baby washing detergent. So I looked online and some mum recommended this one. We tried and my baby's eczema did turn better. Of course, we were treating him very carefully at the same time so this soap may be a reason or not. But at least it didn't make it worse. So we will keep going with this. Extra point is for totally no scents after washing.
customer_reviews.author: 16's Sis

customer_reviews.title: Terrific alternative to conventional - works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works terrific. Also, love their alternative to bleach product. Super if sensitive to scent, but because I really prefer a little scent, I pair half the amount recommended with scented MyGreenFills, available online directly on their website (half amount for load).
customer_reviews.author: ladymda

customer_reviews.title: Get the Packets Instead
customer_reviews.text: When I received my items, the bags had broken d spilled all over the box, my floors and was on all my other items which were supplements so I cleaned the bottles as best as I could but I'm feeling not great about consuming something that has laundry detergent all over it even if it was just the packaging... Worst part these can't be returned, so I just wanted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Bex Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have used Charlie's laundry detergent for a number of years. It's the only one I use as it cleans so well, does not leave a residue, no scent, rinses out completely so I don't need fabric softener, and the cost is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: HRS

customer_reviews.title: Thorough clean every time
customer_reviews.text: This works great - only need very little and clothes come out smelling brand new and very fresh. I use this on my sons cloth diapers and works great - even getting poop out!
customer_reviews.author: M. Zombro

customer_reviews.title: Better scent and cleaning power then Nellies
customer_reviews.text: I use nellies on my delicates and black clothing and found the smell to be a little chemical, cleaning power was just ok and dissolved just ok. This is much better then Nellies! The scent is a very very mild clean smell, the cleaning power is a little better then nellies and dissolves about the same. I will definitely but this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: K.Sabby

customer_reviews.title: Only use this if your clothes are already clean
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to use this to clean my dog's urinary incontinence diapers ("belly bands"). All I can say is, of people think this is effective they must not be using it for difficult stains. I have to run three hot water washes for the belly bands to get clean. I may as well have just run three hot washes without adding anything. This stuff is basically just salt, nothing more. Please save your money.
customer_reviews.author: wrcheatham

customer_reviews.title: Rough feeling in the clothes. Additional softener needed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for washing baby clothes. Unfortunately the fabrics feel very rough if you don't use a softener... and softeners are not recommended for baby clothes... So it might not be the bes t option for baby clothes. Still looking for a good detergent for this purposes. Also, The product doesn't remove stains as labeled. I washed a table cloth three times and a tea stain is still there...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been a faithful customer for years
customer_reviews.text: Bee using Charlie's Soap for over 10 years now. Even used to have the company ship directly to me when I loved out of the country! The only reason for 4 stars: without a booster or additive of some sort, it doesn't always get grease out all the way. I add a few drops of original Dawn to my loads and it works just fine. They have a product that helps as well, I believe. I know that most laundry detergent and especially fabric softeners leave behind TOXIC chemicals. Charlie's does not!! Only fresh soft clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great clean!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'll use another detergent ever again! I love that you don't need a lot of this and my clothes are so fresh after washing! I have tried many fragrance free detergents and this one is BY FAR my favorite. It cleans really well and it leaves things so fresh and odor free. I mostly hang dry my clothes and dont use a fabric softener, and I've noticed it really keeps things clean smelling waaay better than other detergents. I would recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Deep cleans with small amount
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and really does the job with a small amount of detergent. We use it to wash our cloth diapers and after 2 years, the diapers look nearly new. It removes tough stains yet is gentle. We also foster dogs and use it to get the towels/blankets clean after they’re adopted. Cleans them well and gets all stains/scents out! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than expected, I’ve bought this multiple times now and I’m happy with the great results. I tend to be sensitive to most commercial products with strong chemicals, and this product saved my skin!
customer_reviews.author: Gita

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works
customer_reviews.text: I like this laundry soap. No fragrance at all. Gets blood & grim out of my husbands clothes. Leaves them soft.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Jack

customer_reviews.title: Found my detergent!
customer_reviews.text: Cleans my clothes, feels natural to my sensitive skin, overall happy with this purchase & will do it again. I use a laundromat so I can't keep using the same soap in the machine, which would be better, but I still feel like it works better than many natural laundry detergents.
customer_reviews.author: Julez

customer_reviews.title: Good all around detergent for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: this detergent doesn't make my very sensitive skin break out which is awesome! It also gets my stuff super clean including my front loader washer. Occasionally I have to run a load through twice. I always wash things on Heavy and cold. leaves no buildup on laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimate Consumer

customer_reviews.title: So far the soap has been good in washes
customer_reviews.text: So far the soap has been good in washes. My clothes and linens come out smelling clean without stains. I even used it on my uniform which reeks of pizza and it smells fresh. The only reason I'm doing a 3 star rating is because the bag was punctured in my box and the soap was all over the box and other items that were in the shipment. It just makes me sad that there was wasted product that I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ellis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a laundry soap that rinsed clean and this is my new answer. Charlie's seems to rinse completely leaving just clean -- it's unscented, but just that clean scent is good for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mathena

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this after problems with mold and liquid detergent with my front loader. Now have a top loader and still use Charlie's. Dissolves well. Unscented. Leaves clothes clean with no masking perfumes.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great hypoallergenic laundry soap!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is sensitive to most laundry soaps, and we are both concerned with the ingredients that are common in most commercial soaps. When we searched for an alternative, this laundry powder came highly recommended. We are really pleased with how clean it makes the clothes feel and there is no smell other than "clean". Also, it lasts a long time because you don't have to use much. I would say that the 2.64 pound tub lasts us about three months, give or take. All in all, we recommend for anyone who might be sensitive to allergens or concerned with questionable ingredients found in most laundry detergents.
customer_reviews.author: Han and Leia Solo

customer_reviews.title: ... decided to switch from Gain and I am definitely glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to switch from Gain and I am definitely glad I did. Our clothes seem to be more bright and it does not irritate my newborn's skin, especially since we often to throw a receiving blanket on us. I also washed my baby's clothes with Charlie's Soap and her clothes were fine. I definitely will begin to make the switch for her clothes once we run out of Dreft.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

product_meta.title: Charlie’s Soap Laundry Powder (100 Loads, 1 Pack) Fragrance Free Hypoallergenic Deep Cleaning Laundry Powder – Biodegradable Laundry Detergent That Is Both Safe and Effective
product_meta.description: The secret to a happy life with clean clothes while doing your share for Mother Earth shouldn’t be complicated. Use our concentrated Laundry Powder detergent. It deep cleans your laundry for only pennies per wash (one tablespoon per large load), as it removes trapped odors and stains. Hypoallergenic, non-toxic, safer for the environment. Plus, it removes residues from your previous detergent. No need for fabric softener, either. Septic safe. With each wash, clothes washed in Charlie's Soap get cleaner and cleaner.
feature_bullets: ECO-FRIENDLY CLEANING POWER: Concentrated Laundry Powder works on all your laundry, from high-tech fabrics to delicates, washing away smells, stains, and left-behind residue from previous detergents.

HYPOALLERGENIC: Non-toxic washing soda and powerful, natural ingredients work together to ring on your clothes (when used as directed). The fragrance-free formula is ideal for thoseinse fabrics completely and leave noth with sensitive skin and will not cover stains or odors with artificial brighteners or perfumes. Safe for hand washing.

LESS IS MORE: Each bag contains just four ingredients and one tablespoon per dose. No suds, just a deep clean that leaves fabric fresh and soft.
